oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Davis, Theodore (1840-1894)
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sketch Map of Chattanooga
Sketch Map Vicinity of Chattanooga
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Map of Chattanooga, Tennessee, and vicinity with locations and dates, as well as notations about troop positions and movements, of battles of Chickamauga and Lookout Mountain.

Theodore Davis (1840-1894) was a "Special Artist" for news magazines such as Harper's Weekly and Leslie's Illustrated Weekly, illustrating news reports from the front. He was in the Chattanooga area in 1863 and 1864. While he may have done this at the time of the battles, Davis also made drawings for various publications in the decades after the Civil War.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Davis, Theodore R. (1840-1894); Chattanooga (Tenn.), Battle of; United States -- History -- Civil War; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Battlefields
The Persistence of Memory; Visualizing the War
